meanings.sent1: The scientists hydrocracked the oil to make it cleaner.
meanings.sent2: The refinery hydrocracked the crude oil to produce gasoline.
meanings.sent3: The oil was so dirty that they had to hydrocrack it to make it usable.
meanings.sent4: She hydrocracked the problem, breaking it down into smaller parts to solve it.
meanings.sent5: The process of hydrocracking transforms the oil into valuable products.

meanings.sent1: The hydrocracked fuel burned more efficiently in the engine.
meanings.sent2: The hydrocracked gasoline had a higher octane rating.
meanings.sent3: The hydrocracked oil was so pure that it sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her hydrocracked hair shone brightly under the lights.
meanings.sent5: The hydrocracked material was used in various industrial applications.
